critique: This executive order focuses on promoting physical fitness and sports through a national program coordinated by the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare. It establishes the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports and a Conference on Physical Fitness and Sports to advise and assist in these efforts. The order encourages cooperation between federal, state, and local governments, as well as private organizations, to improve physical fitness programs. It also emphasizes research and improvements in school health and physical education programs. There is a slight expansion of executive power through the establishment of councils and conferences, but it is primarily focused on coordination and advice rather than direct control. The order does not directly address issues of immigration, security, economic regulation, or social inclusion, so those scores are neutral. The ideological tilt is also neutral, as physical fitness is not inherently a left- or right-leaning issue.
